factorial.desc: Returns the factorial of the number given. Has an upper limit due to maximum integer storage

toPolar.desc: Returns Polar (r, angle) coords from 2D Cartesian <x y> coords.

toCart2D.desc: Returns 2D Cartesian (x,y) coords from Polar <r angle> coords.

primefact.desc: Returns prime factorization of the given number

toCart3D.desc: Converts from Cylindrical <x, theta, z> or Spherical <x theta phi> coordinates into Cartesian (x, y) coordinates

toSphere.desc: Converts from Cartesian <x y> or Cylindrical <x theta z> coordinates into Spherical (x, theta, phi) coordinates

toCyl.desc: Converts from Cartesian <x y> or Spherical <x theta phi> coordinates into Cylindrical, (x, theta, z) coordinates

portal.desc: Calculates the x and y equivalent coordinates in the Nether from the Overworld coords in Minecraft

quad.desc: Calculates the quadratic solution(s) for <a> <b> <c> in ax^2+bx+c = 0

average.desc: Calculates the average of the list of numbers given

cipher.desc: Generates or decrypts a secret code!

decrypt.desc: Creates a gradient from the specified arguments

encrypt.desc: Encrypts the <message> sent and send it to the user

bilinear.desc: Creates an image of a bilinear interpolation of colors

gradient.desc: Creates a gradient from the specified arguments

help.desc: Send you this guide with the commands in a tree structure. Use >>>help <command> [subcommand] for more specific help

info.desc: Gives owner and bot info like uptime and language used

coin.desc: Tosses a coin <X> times and replies with the list of results and percentage of each.

game.desc: Sets bot's status or game it's playing to <text>

hug.desc: Sends a hug to [mentionedUser]. If not, will send a random hug to the server.

integer.desc: Provides a random integer with a random length from 1 to 75. Optional argument allows you to pick [pos | neg].

latex.desc: Provides the image version from google a properly formatted equation.

map.desc:
Maps an <value> from <input Minimum> to <inputMaximum> to an optional [output min] to [output max].
If only 3 values given, it will map between 0 and 1 inclusive.

ping.desc: Tests if the bot is up by sending "Pong!" as a reply.

poll.desc: Create a poll, vote on one or view an old one.

reverse.desc: Reverses <text> based on provided way <-a | -w> all letters or all words.

roll.desc: Rolls an <n> sided dice <m> times and sends back the results.

rpg.desc: Will respond with a randomly named item that has 3 randomized stats.

series.desc: Need a special series? Like triangular numbers or Collatz?

8ball.desc: Ask a question. It'll provide an answer. If you don't, it'll give a snarky reply.

10-print.desc: Creates a random maze-like pattern using \ and /
